Authors:
Asha Janadaree Dissanayake, Narumon Tangthirasunun, Liu
Mei, Zhen Chen, Erio Camporesi, Kevin D Hyde, XingHong Li, JiYe Yan
Title:
Diaporthe species on grapevine and other woody hosts, with
descriptions of two new species
Keywords:
Diaporthe aseana, Diaporthe garethjonesii, morphology,
phylogeny, phytopathogens, sordariomycetes, Vitis vinifera
Abstract:
Diaporthe species are known as pathogens of trees and
woody hosts, including fruit trees worldwide, where they are often
associated with spots in living leaves and may also be saprobes on plant
materials. In this study, collections of Diaporthe from several woody
hosts in Italy and Thailand and grapevine in Guangxi and Hubei Provinces
in China were identified based on morphological characters and analyses
of ITS, EF1-α, β-tubulin and CAL gene sequence data. Two new species of
Diaporthe, D. aseana and D. garethjonesii were identified on dead leaves
from Thailand. Nine known species including Diaporthe biconispora, D.
eres, D. eucalyptorum, D. foeniculina, D. fraxini-angustifoliae, D.
mahothocarpus, D. oncostoma, D. siamensis and D. sojae were studied from
China, Italy and Thailand. For the first time, D. fraxini-angustifoliae
and D. mahothocarpus were reported from China, and from grapevine
worldwide. Most of the Diaporthe species were found on only one host,
with the exception of D. oncostoma which was isolated from Clematis and
Robinia species in Italy.
